About UsAt our company we're driven by a shared mission: to make the world a safer place. We harness the power of novel data and artificial intelligence/machine learning to gain deeper insights into commercial insurance risk. Our cutting-edge software empowers brokers and policyholders to predict and prevent complex claims through data-driven tools and Smart Commercial Insurance policies. By reducing the impact of adverse events, we are creating a safer world for everyone. Drawing inspiration from the intelligent and tool-building corvid family of birds, we are a team of high-flying collaborative builders, and we're thrilled to have you join our flock. So spread your wings, and soar with us!Job DescriptionThe company is seeking an enthusiastic Assistant Vice President of Cyber & Tech E&O Underwriting to play a pivotal role in elevating efficiency for our Cyber and Technology Errors and Omissions business. If you possess strong leadership skills, foster excellent broker relationships, and have a passion for revolutionizing commercial insurance, then this opportunity is tailor-made for you.As an AVP at the company, you'll leverage our state-of-the-art technology platform to streamline your day-to-day tasks, boosting productivity and paving the way for innovation. Say goodbye to the mundane and step into a dynamic, forward-thinking insurance environment where your potential is boundless. This role begins as an individual contributor but has the potential to evolve into a leadership position.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate closely with brokers to ensure their understanding of renewals for the upcoming year and their satisfaction with the terms.Handle new and renewal business submissions, promptly responding to broker queries and requests.Skillfully negotiate with brokers to close deals and diligently follow up on outstanding quotes.Provide valuable insights to the executive team on renewal trends.Work with senior leadership to devise a sales and marketing plan, identifying opportunities to enhance renewal efficiency.Underwrite, produce, and bind Cyber and Tech E&O business within the company's underwriting appetite.Enjoy flexibility for travel as required.Achieve premium production and sales goals while building a profitable book of cyber business.Embrace technology and eagerly contribute to the growth of a team committed to transforming P&C commercial insurance for brokers and policyholders.Foster a collaborative spirit, working closely with underwriters, underwriting assistants, and the Corvus management team.Uphold high-quality service standards and ensure compliance with all underwriting guidelines.Act as a representative of the company by attending external functions, industry conferences, and other relevant events.What You'll Bring To The FlockAt least 5 years of Cyber and Technology E&O underwriting experience.Proficiency in underwriting Excess & Surplus lines of business.Demonstrate exceptional customer service by promptly addressing broker queries and concerns.Possess strong broker relationships, particularly within the NW territory, including large retail brokerages.Be open to suggesting alternatives if existing company policies and practices can be improved.Previous leadership experience is a plus.Our CommitmentAt the company, we cherish diversity and welcome individuals from all walks of life. We believe there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate, and we encourage everyone to apply if this role excites you and aligns with your aspirations. We value equitable compensation for exceptional performance. While the salary range for this position is estimated to be $130,000 - $157,500, actual salaries may vary based on factors like experience, skills, and geography. Performance-based incentives are also available.Additionally, you'll enjoy an array of world-class benefits, including stock/equity options, generous PTO (minimum 3 weeks/year encouraged), hybrid work arrangements, sabbatical opportunities, 401(k) matching, professional development support, wellness reimbursement, and comprehensive health, dental & vision coverage. Being part of our Corvid family comes with numerous rewards, and we'd love to discuss them further with you.Employment Type: Full-TimeSalary: $ 130,000.00 157,500.00 Per Year
